output: An integer corresponding to the number of months that Dilson can donate his money.
input: The input consists of an integer M (0 ≤ M ≤ 1018) representing the initial Dilson money, two real numbers p (0 < p ≤ 100) and j (0 ≤ j ≤ 100) of five decimal places each representing the percentage of it Dilson donates and how much interest he receives per month and an integer x (1 ≤ x ≤ 106) that represents the minimum amount that the money must render per month.
name: Donor
description:
Dilson, Gilson or Wilson, as you prefer to call it, is one of the few good miners you've ever heard of. Every year it helps needy communities, towns, day care centers and schools. That year, Dilson, who is one of the wealthiest men in Minas Gerais, wants to donate part of his savings. He plans to donate p per cent of the total money he owns per month. Gilson's money (that is, Dilson) is kept in an application that yields j percent every month. Dilson uses a portion of this income to pay his bills, which totals x reais per month, and spends the remainder of him traveling.

Behold, he asked himself, "If I continue to donate my money and spend the proceeds in this manner, how many months will I be able to pay the bills?"
